The Beatles had a running rivalry with the Beach Boys, who had already mined the sun-is-love metaphor in the haunting 1964 ballad, “Warmth of the Sun.”  Since the Beach Boys had already staked out theterritory of writing a sad song about the sun, Paul takes the silly love song approach, which was quickly becoming one of his trademark traits.
